ratings.comment: Professor Moses is a very kind teacher and shows he cares about his work/teachings a lot... however there are 2 or 3 long (25-page roughly) reading assigned for each lecture/class ... with little benefit if you read on your own time as he goes over it in class. That being said he cares a lot for participation in lecture yet doesn't lead discussions

Professor was very scattered and often went over class time. The entire course is graded on about 4-5 assignments which really sucks: if you do poorly on one you can't get you grade back up. He clearly is passionate and knowledgable, but the course had absolutely no flow and did not make sense together. Was bunch of random things shoved together.

Professor Moses was a very cool person. The only bad things I experienced with his class were the long readings (which he would be mad if you didn't read), and the fact that the course was a tad disorganized. I did really enjoy having him as a professor though, and he was very funny! His class was not very difficult despite the long readings.

Warrick is an interesting person, but he is a horrible lecturer, disorganized, and condescending. His lectures were uninteresting and it looked as if he had made them in 5 minutes. The class rarely followed the syllabus, he was frequently gone, and despite giving no incentive to complete the readings, would flip out when students didn't read.
